str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
And thence, and from there; and then afterwards. From kai and ekeithen; likewise from that place.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To come, go.
As far as, up to, until, during. Or achris akh'-rece; akin to akron; until or up to.
Of Latin origin; a forum or market-place; only in comparative with Appios; a station on the Appian road.
Of Latin origin; of Appius, the name of a Roman.
And, even, also, namely.
Three. Or neuter tria a primary number; 'three'.
Plural of Latin origin; huts or wooden-walled buildings; Tabernoe.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From apantao; a encounter.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.
Courage, confidence. Akin to thrasos; boldness.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From eucharistos; to be grateful, i.e. to express gratitude; specially, to say grace at a meal.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
